"This spread is used to examine motivations for plans or ambitions. The cards are arranged so as to call to mind the progression of the seasons and also the progression of any action or plan through the four stages of conception, progression, resolution, and reflection." - Cortese
Dominant for Spring, symbolizing the conception or initiation of an action or ambition, the planting of the seed, so to speak. The modifier for spring is card 8.
Dominant for Summer, symbolizing the progression of a plan, the way in which an idea will flower. The modifier for summer is card 2.
Dominant for Autumn, symbolizing the resolution of the plan, how events will "wind themselves up." The modifier for autumn is card 4.

Dominant for Winter, symbolizing the period of reflection after an action or plan has been completed, or what the querent may wish to learn from the progression of events. The modifier for winter is card 6.
